meanings.definition: To spread out awkwardly or carelessly
meanings.sent1: The books spawl across the table after I accidentally knocked them over.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to spawl out in the sun on lazy afternoons.
meanings.sent3: I tried to carry too many groceries at once, causing them to spawl all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: The vines spawl up the side of the house, creating a wild and untamed look.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's toys spawl across the living room, creating a colorful mess.

meanings.sent1: The abandoned building was a spawl of broken windows and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent2: The city's outskirts were a spawl of factories and warehouses.
meanings.sent3: The pile of laundry on the floor looked like a spawl of mismatched colors.
meanings.sent4: The old attic was a spawl of forgotten treasures and dusty memories.
meanings.sent5: The junkyard was a spawl of discarded cars and rusted metal.
